solution_line_template: He is washing {weight_shirts} ounces of shirts because {num_shirts} x {weight_per_shirt} = <<{num_shirts}*{weight_per_shirt}={weight_shirts}>>{weight_shirts}
He is washing {weight_socks} ounces of socks because {num_socks_pairs} x {weight_per_sock_pair} = <<{num_socks_pairs}*{weight_per_sock_pair}={weight_socks}>>{weight_socks}

He is already washing {current_total_weight} ounces of clothes because {weight_pants} + {weight_shirts} + {weight_shorts} + {weight_socks} = <<{weight_pants}+{weight_shirts}+{weight_shorts}+{weight_socks}={current_total_weight}>>{current_total_weight}
He can wash {remaining_capacity} more ounces because {max_weight_allowed} - {current_total_weight} = <<{max_weight_allowed}-{current_total_weight}={remaining_capacity}>>{remaining_capacity}
He can wash {num_underwear_pairs} pairs of underwear because {remaining_capacity} / {weight_per_underwear} = <<{remaining_capacity}/{weight_per_underwear}={num_underwear_pairs}>>{num_underwear_pairs}
